column5: Hey Guys,  I'm looking for a decent website for fly tying patterns. I normally go on flyanglersonline.com.  Does anyone know and others that have good step by step instructions?  Thanks,  Dave
I get most of my fly-fishing/tying info from Hipwader.com. Lots of local stuff in the forums as well.

If you're just starting to learn, I suggest going to a local fly fishing club like Izaak Walton's.  Kitchener has one too but I don't recall the name.  It's much more difficult to learn on your own, and other tyers can steer you clear of some of the errors.  But if you're not just starting, sorry I don't have any sites off hand.
nope not starting out....just looking for other sources, thanks though
Lot of flies on this site:  http://www.michigan-sportsman.com/fly_pict...ettymcnault.htm  Regards, Snowball
Lots of videos to watch on this site:  http://www.youtube.com/profile_videos?user=NEWFLIES&p=r  Regards, Snowball

Alright heres what I have used, dont know which are gonna be good for you but good luck  http://onlineflytyer.com/flybox.asp http://www.virtualflybox.com/patterns/index.php?view=4 http://www.flyflinger.com/patterns.php  Those are dome that I use and like i have others around somwhere but that should be a good start for you
....Also lots to see hee....http://globalflyfisher.com/  or perhaps a look at the real thing....http://www.troutnut.com/
